text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I got so many requests to do something Sci-fi
from emails and online and on my

Facebook. So, today we are gonna be making
Stargate Cookies! Mmmm!

The things you will need, will be: 1 big mixing
bowl, sugar cookie mix, flour,

a gingerbread man cookie cutter, 2 circle
cookie cutters, just make sure 1 is large

and 1 is a little bit smaller, a stick of
butter, and an egg.
Let’s put it all together!

Now you’re gonna take your mixer, and you’re
gonna beat for 2 minutes
on medium speed.

Once you finish mixing your batter, you’re
gonna get your hands dirty, and

stick ‘em in the bowl, and start massaging
the dough.

And you just keep doing it until it’s a
bit more moldable, then we’ll roll it out!

Take a little bit of flour, a little pinch
of flour, a handful if you have really
small hands! Put it down, put down your ball.

And I like to put a little flour on the top
of it too!

Now, take your rolling pin, I also like to
coat that in flour, so that doesn’t stick.

And then you’re just gonna lightly roll
it out.

Once you’ve got your dough all rolled out,
what you want to do is line

your cookie sheet with a piece of wax paper,
and we’re gonna now cut out the little
star gates.
So use the bigger circle first, neep-neep-neep-neep!

Use a flipper, pick him up, and put him on
the wax paper.

And then you’re gonna take your smaller
circle, line him up in the middle,

nee-nee-nee-nee-nee! Then you’re gonna take
this little toothpick,

pick out the middle. I found that this way
works better than trying to transport

the thin ring onto the cookie sheet, otherwise
it gets kind of warped.
Looks like an oval, like a weird oval.

Ta-da! Now we’re gonna cut out our little
gingerbread sugar cookie men!
Little Starfleet officers! Oh, so cute!

And then we’re just gonna cut him out, take
my little flipper,
and put him on your tray.

Before we put the cookies into the oven, we’re
gonna take the circle cookies,

like so, and fill them with Jolly Ranchers.
This is a really cool technique, a lot

of people do this for holiday cookies, but
I’m gonna be using it to make these

look like the actual event horizon in the
middle.

It’s gonna be all blue and shiny, it’s
gonna look really, really cool.

OK, so, you dump ‘em out, and you’re gonna
pick out just the blue ones,

that’s all you want. And then you’re gonna
unwrap ‘em, put him in the bag.

I’ve already done a few ahead of time, so
I saved some time.
Now take your hammer, crack ‘em.
Ta-da!

Take a little handful of Jolly Rancher and
put him in the middle.

A little tip, that I would suggest doing,
is fill them a little bit higher than you
think that you would have to. Da-da!

Once these are all done, we can put them in
the oven at 350 and you bake

for about 6 minutes. But keep a close eye
on ‘em because these cookies are

a little bit thinner and you don’t want
them to burn!

Once your cookies are done baking, take them
out of the oven and make sure

they’ve had plenty of time to cool! You
want to make sure that they’re completely

hard, no soft cookies, or else they’ll be
falling apart!

Look what they look like, they ended up so
cool! Ahhhh!

Look at our little Stargates! Eeee! Little
wormhole, hello!

Now it is time to decorate, I have pre-dyed
all these cookie icings, we have

white, gray, green, black and skin fleshy
tones.

We’re gonna start with gray, and I’m gonna
frost him first, our little Stargate!

Now we’re gonna let this 1 dry, because
we’re gonna add some layers on top, and

we’re gonna make our first little crew member, using
the green cookie icing.

Once you’re done frosting your cookies,
do this to all of your other cookies and
wait 10 minutes for them to dry!

The cookies have dried and now we’re going
to add another level of decoration.

You’re going to take your black cookie icing,
and we’re gonna draw little
combat vests. Weee, boop!

I’m gonna draw his little gun strap, here’s
their little combat boots!

This, this is how you draw boots… Oops,
also might want to look when you’re doing it.

Once you got the black decoration, little
camo gear on, we’re gonna decorate
the skin color.

While we wait for the skin color frosting
to set, we’re gonna take yellow fondant,

and if you don’t have fondant you can use
Laffy Taffy, you can use Starburst,

you just roll it out, just anything moldable,
that’s fine.

And we’re gonna cut little triangles, and
put ‘em right on the top.
You’re gonna have to cut out, pfft, pfft!

And you’re gonna cut out 9 of them, to be
the little chevrons!

I just evenly spaced ‘em out. And you’re
gonna take gray frosting, and we’re just
gonna add some extra details to our Stargate!

Da-dew! We’re all done with the little icings,
now you’re just gonna do this to

all of your cookies, and you can start decorating
your little officers.
This ones all dry, so you can make their little faces and hair!

Ta-da! All of our little Stargate cookies
are all done, we have the actual

Stargates with the Jolly Rancher center, woo!
They’re so cute!

And, we have all of our commanding officers,
well I picked my 4 favorite from SG1.

So, OK, we have Teal’c, Dr. Jackson, Major
Carter and Commander O’Neil.

I couldn’t really get her hair right, but
that’s OK, I’m gonna eat her anyways!

Thanks you guys for suggesting a Sci-fi episode,
this is 1 of my favorite Sci-fi’s.

I also love Battlestar Galactica, Firefly,
anything Josh Weeden really does,
and, um, yes, maybe in a future episode!

But, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
OK, thanks you guys, bye-bye!
